intro: Hexaglottis virgata subsp. karooica, commonly known as the Karoo hexaglottis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It features lance-shaped leaves and produces vibrant blue or purple flowers. This subspecies is often found in the Karoo region, where it thrives in open, sunny habitats.
